translated: For sentient beings, he teaches the Dharma as follows: ‘The emptiness of all things is not limited.🔽It does not go and does not come.’

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of the emptiness of all phenomena is non-going.

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of the emptiness of defining characteristics is non-going.

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying: “It does not go, it does not come.”

analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the doctrine to beings saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

original: tshad med pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the doctrine to beings saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the doctrine to beings saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

original: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of the deliverances is non-going.

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the doctrine to beings saying: “It does not go and does not come.”

original: mthar gyis ngas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis ngas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: “The emptiness of the emptiness of non-apprehension is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of non-repudiation is neither fettered nor liberated.”

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /🔽de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste / de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: “The emptiness of the emptiness of essential nature is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of non-entities is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of self-existence is neither fettered nor liberated.”

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /🔽de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste / de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: “The emptiness of the emptiness of other-existence is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of both existence and non-existence is neither fettered nor liberated.”

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi stong pa nyid @393a *//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi stong pa nyid @393a *//
translated: “The emptiness of the emptiness of the conditioned is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the unconditioned is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the past is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the future is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the present is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the internal is neither fettered nor liberated.”

original: ni 'gro ba med pa ste /🔽de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: ni 'gro ba med pa ste / de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: “The emptiness of the emptiness of the external is neither fettered nor liberated.”

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /🔽de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /🔽de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: “The emptiness of the emptiness of the internal and the external is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the great is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the ultimate is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the compounded is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the uncompounded is neither fettered nor liberated.”🔽“The emptiness of the emptiness of the compounded and the uncompounded is neither fettered nor liberated.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of the powers of the tathāgatas is non-going.

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the doctrine to beings, saying, ‘It does not go and it does not come.’

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong ngo zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the doctrine to beings, saying, ‘It does not go and it does not come.’

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lam du gyur pa yin no //
translated: become the path for beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te /

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: and they do not transcend that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: stong pa nyid la 'gro ba'i ma 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
translated: it is because one cannot apprehend the coming or going of emptiness.

analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: Su­bhūti, all things have the nature of signlessness,

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: and they do not transcend that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽mtshan ma med @394a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / mtshan ma med @394a *//
translated: If you ask why,

original: pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
translated: it is because one cannot apprehend the coming or going of signlessness.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni smon pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni smon pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: Su­bhūti, all things have the nature of aspirationlessness,

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: and they do not transcend that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: smon pa med pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: smon pa med pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
translated: it is because one cannot apprehend the coming or going of aspirationlessness.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: Su­bhūti, all things have the nature of the absence of formative predispositions,

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: and they do not transcend that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
translated: Because going and coming are not apprehended in what is not formed.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mi skye mi 'gag pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mi skye mi 'gag pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena have the nature of not being produced and not ceasing;

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: they do not pass beyond that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: mi skye mi 'gag pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi skye mi 'gag pa la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
translated: Because going and coming are not apprehended in what is not produced and does not cease.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena have the nature of being without defilement and without purification;

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o /
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o /
translated: they do not pass beyond that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena have the nature of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: and they do not pass beyond that nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
translated: Subhūti, in that unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, coming or going is not apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: de ltar zab pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la su zhig mos par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar zab pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la su zhig mos par 'gyur /
translated: “Lord, who will believe in this perfection of wisdom, which is so deep?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngon gyi sangs rgyas @408a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngon gyi sangs rgyas @408a *//
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who have planted good roots under past lord buddhas,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi drung du spyad par gyur pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi drung du spyad par gyur pa /
translated: they have practiced in the presence of the blessed buddhas;

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa /

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba /

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba de dag ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba de dag ni /
translated: they have been taken hold of by spiritual friends.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have conviction in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ba de dag gi rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ba de dag gi rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: what will be the nature of those bodhisattva great beings who will have conviction in this profound perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi tshul dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam pa ni ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi tshul dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam pa ni ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: What will be the way, the signs, and the indications of those bodhisattva great beings?🔽”

original: le'u sum cu drug pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u sum cu drug pa'o ////
translated: This was the thirty-sixth chapter, “The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Many Hundred Thousand Lines.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Śāriputra,

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ba de dag ni /
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who will believe in this deep perfection of wisdom

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

translated: “Lord, it is difficult for bodhisattva great beings to don the armor who have set out with the thought, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and liberate all sentient beings from birth and death,’ but who do not apprehend a sentient being or the designation of a sentient being.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no /

translated: “The one who dons the armor with the thought, ‘I will lead all sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa,’ should not fear the two levels of the śrāvakas

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa mtshams bcad de /

analyzed: sems can gyi don du go cha 'tshal ba ma lags so //
translated: The bodhisattva great being does not don the armor for the sake of a limited number of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: de skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar go cha bgos shing /
analyzed: de skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar go cha bgos shing /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa des nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being who thus equips himself with the great armour, and who courses in this deep perfection of wisdom, should not fear, tremble, or be struck with terror.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas gnyis su dogs par mi bya'o zhes smras /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas gnyis su dogs par mi bya'o zhes smras /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i slad du go cha 'tshal to //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni sems can nyung zad nyi tshe'i don du go bgos pa ma yin /
